citation.article-title: Umboniibacter marinipuniceus gen. nov., sp. nov., a marine gammaproteobacterium isolated from the mollusc Umbonium costatum from the Sea of Japan
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Umboniibacter (Um.bo.ni.i.bac′ter. N.L. n. Umbonium scientific name of a genus of marine mollusc; N.L. masc. n. bacter rod; N.L. masc. n. Umboniibacter a rod from Umbonium, referring to the isolation of the first strains from the sand snail U. costatum).
Gram-negative, aerobic, oxidase-positive, weakly catalase-positive, rod-shaped bacteria.
Sodium ions are essential for growth.
The predominant isoprenoid quinone is Q-7.
Polar lipids include phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol and diphosphatidylglycerol.
The major fatty acids are C17 : 1ω6c, C17 : 0, C16 : 0 and C16 : 1ω7c.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain of the type species is 51.7 mol% (thermal denaturation method).
On the basis of 16S rRNA gene sequence analysis, the genus represents a separate branch within the Gammaproteobacteria, related to the genera Endozoicomonas, Simiduia and Microbulbifer.
Known strains have been isolated from the marine environment.
The type species of the genus is Umboniibacter marinipuniceus.
